ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We gained a basic familiarity with musical traditions spanning from North Africa to the US South, including tarab, blues, and jazz. We also read many (essential) theoretical texts thinking about music and liberation, as well as how theory and (especially) theologies tie into these.

Learned an immense amount about the history and philosophy of the blues tradition and African American musicmaking traditions and innovation, as well as its connections to Islamic theology, art, music, and writing. I also greatly expanded my musical tastes in this course!
I read some important texts (e.g. Black Marxism) and practiced doing aesthetic analyses of music and different art forms.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class would have faired better as a longer seminar than a shorter two day meeting. Discussions always felt like they would reach a zenith at the end of our instruction.

Strengths: Incredibly engaging subject matter and course materials, including music, film, visual arts, writing. Professor also created a very generative space for discussion that flowed much more than I've seen in most other classes.
Weaknesses: Truly can't think of much.

The course was somewhat poorly organizedthe syllabus didn't really have an arc or sense of cohesion to it, and class sessions often felt like they jumped around without relating to each other. Also, we had a small class, but discussion usually wasn't facilitated in a way that encouraged flow. I think the syllabus could be tightened and given more direction so that the core questions of the course could be better addressed.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! The lessons learned and works introduced are works that one can carry for the rest of your life. Its very difficult to come into contact with this kinda of instruction and is novel when having it.
I would not recommend this course to another student unless the syllabus is tightened and the discussions more intentionally guided.
